Cyber Capability Fund
Executive Summary

•	CardConnect has identified over $600M in potential revenue opportunities within First Data's existing merchant portfolio that are
        susceptible to share shift from competitors due to weaknesses in those providers product capabilities.
•	Merchants that utilize a payment gateway, a software application that authorizes payments for businesses, often have their overall
        payment processing costs increased substantially due to this additional layer of technology.
•	CardConnect represents a single source technology platform that gives us a significant competitive advantage because we own both the
        gateway and processing capabilities and can eliminate the costs added by competing gateway providers.
•	CardConnect has created entire business units, staffed with sales and operational support teams, in order to capitalize on these
        share shift opportunities and the Cyber Capability Fund enhances those efforts.
   The purpose of the Cyber Capability Fund is to provide financial flexibility to optimize the economics of share shift opportunities where
        our technology provides a significant competitive advantage.

• CardConnect maintains an overall 35% margin and believes it is justified to reduce margins to no less than 5% on share shift
        opportunities where the revenue potential is significant.

•	The overall profitability and duration of our merchant relationships is significantly higher than the industry average.
•	We have identified over 100,000 merchant locations and have completed thousands of financial analyses to quantify the revenue
        potential where we can eliminate competing gateway providers (detailed in the Addendums).
•	We have made significant investments in accounting and reporting infrastructure to accurately measure performance against the Cyber
        Capability Fund.
•	Please refer to the included Addendums for additional information:
•	Addendum I: Merchant Portfolio Analysis: Volume, revenue and merchant location analysis.
•	Addendum Il: Share Shift Analysis: Merchant, volume and revenue opportunity within a targeted portfolio.
•	Addendum Ill: Cyber Capability Fund: Economic model of a share shift opportunity utilizing the Cyber Capability Fund.

Addendum I
Merchant Portfolio Analysis
•	CardConnect has performed extensive analysis of First Data's merchant portfolio in order to identify potential share shift
    opportunities.
•	We began by segmenting the merchant portfolio into three categories:
    1)  Enterprise Merchants: Merchants processing in excess of $50M in annual volume.
    2)  Mid-Market Merchants: Merchants processing between $5M and $50M annually.
    3)  Small Business Merchants (SMB): Merchants processing less than $5M annually.
•	CardConnect then created scoring criteria based on common characteristics of merchants that utilize an independent payment
    gateway.
•	This includes, but is not limited to, merchants that operate in a card-not-present environment (i.e. online), utilize a software
    application to manage their business (i.e. an ERP system), or have unique transaction requirements (i.e. support tips, tax,
    recurring billing, etc.).
•	The results of the analysis identified over 100,000 merchant locations, representing almost $200B in processing volume, that are
    likely supported by a competing third-party payment gateway.
• Refer to the following page to see the volume, revenue and merchant location analysis.

Addendum III
Cyber Capability Fund

The following financial model illustrates how CardConnect can utilize the Cyber Capability Fund in order to enhance its competitive
position within First Data's existing merchant portfolio.
Merchant Profile: A top 25 e-commerce retailer in the USA with over $700M in annual processing volume. The merchant's payment
environment consists of a complex integration with their internal systems and a third party gateway to connect to their payment
processor.
Opportunity: CardConnect provides a single source solution that incorporates gateway and processing services, as such, we can
eliminate the need for the customers existing gateway provider. The customer will maintain their existing systems integration but will
eliminate monthly fees, transaction fees, and other costs associated with a third party gateway.
Annual Processing Volume:	$712,000,000
Annual Revenue (Existing):	$2,207,000
Annual Revenue Opportunity: CardConnect has determined there is a potential net revenue opportunity of $1,102,000,
after eliminating fees from an existing third party gateway provider, which represents an overall margin of 15.5 bps.
Cyber Capability Fund: CardConnect would pursue the revenue opportunity by leveraging the Cyber Capability
Fund and reducing our overall margin down to 5 bps, while maximizing the overall revenue potential.
Annual Revenue (CardConnect):	$356,000
Annual Revenue Increase:		($1,851,000)

Frank - I wanted to share with you my 5-year vision for Project Ignite as you requested. It's a pretty simple one.

1.  **Year 1 - Technical Integrations**:  We will complete a full a technical integration between CardConnect and First Data during the first year.  The objective of the integration is to eliminate every possible reason a First Data merchant (of any size) would ever be lost to a competitor.  This means integrating our gateway capabilities into Payeezy, Global Gateway, etc. so existing First Data Resellers/ISOs and even bank partners never have to submit a merchant to an outside, competing gateway.  If you look at the composition of many large merchants, you will find a good number supported by a third party gateway (like CyberSource, Authorize.net, USAePay, etc.).  The gateway creates an unnecessary layer of added cost to a merchant and is often the first step in losing the merchant completely because the gateway provider will eventually try and convert them to their own processing platform. By incorporating CardConnect gateway capabilities throughout First Data, we can eliminate the costs often introduced to the merchant from a third party gateway and best position Project Ignite to defend against share shift.  We can also achieve considerable savings by eliminating ~15 competing gateway products within First Data right now and consolidating everyone on a single platform. At present, First Data likely pays out over $150M a year to third party competing gateway providers.  We should also integrate CardConnect technologies within flagship products like Clover.  There are ~50M business applications within the Clover marketplace generating large transaction volumes right now. Those should all be converted to CardConnect accounts ASAP. The objective would be to complete the integration by end of Q1 18 - following the closing of your acquisition.

2.	**Year 1 - Cyber Capability Fund**. Upon closing, we will establish a Cyber Capability Fund to pursue revenue opportunities within the existing First Data merchant portfolio that are supported by a competing third-party gateway. As mentioned in the previous section, CardConnect has some of the best gateway technology in the industry. We have also made insane investments in security that not even the largest banks can match.  This includes a combination of EMV, PCI-validated Point-to-Point Encryption (P2PE) and Tokenization.  In the event First Data were to acquire CardConnect, we would have the best gateway and security product offering and (without question) the largest sales force in the payments industry.  This combination creates an ideal environment to pursue share shift opportunities.  For example, we have already modeled out $600M in potential revenue opportunities where we can eliminate existing gateways and their associated fees within the First Data merchant portfolio.  We are maintaining a very high win rate in pursuit of those merchants where we can eliminate the gateway. While the Cyber Capability Fund will not be utilized in all merchant opportunities, having the flexibility to share some of the cost savings by eliminating the third party gateway with the merchant, will enable Project Ignite to achieve the highest possible win rate.

3.  **Years 2-5 - World Domination.**  The last few years are the best. You will have an integrated gateway and acquiring solution that is simply unmatched by any competitor in the payments industry.  The entire focus will be converting First Data's merchant portfolio to the integrated CardConnect platform to achieve significant savings and eliminate unnecessary costs.  We will also aggressively pursue share shift opportunities outside of the First Data merchant portfolio.  Considering that ~70% of all payment transactions are still supported by an independent gateway, there is a huge addressable market with insane financial upside.

Jared
